meta.name: description
meta.content: The mission of the Health Department is to promote, protect and assure the health, safety, and quality of life through assessment, policy development and assurance, in order that our community will be a safe, healthy place for our citizens to live and raise families.

div.p: Fill out and submit this form to find out. Essential Business Determination Form

The Cole County Health Department is the lead agency for the COVID-19 health issue for Cole County. As of 4-8-2020, the March 27, 2020 Stay at Home Order is hereby amended and the April 8, 2020 Stay at Home Order Amended is enacted in lieu thereof and is set to expire on April 25, 2020 at noon. Please see below.Â

li.a: Cole County Health Department Stay at Home Order Amended 4-8-2020 (PDF)

div.class: inner col col24 first last id01639162-7634-427e-b324-677685229365

a.aria-label: "Stay Home Missouri" Order - Guidance and Frequently Asked Questions Opens in new window

li.a: "Stay Home Missouri" Order - Guidance and Frequently Asked Questions

div.p: The Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS) activated a statewide public hotline for citizens or providers needing guidance regarding COVID-19. The hotline is being operated by medical professionals and is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id7caf6819-6d26-4192-8831-94fe68569748

div.h2: Cole County Health Department Technical Advisory:
div.p: Please share: The Cole County Health Department wants to prevent the spread of COVID-19 within our county while enabling essential services to continue. CCHD has issued a Technical Advisory pertaining to COVID-19 as needed to address issues related to this rapidly changing situation. Technical Advisory #2 was issued on 3-23-2020.

ul.li: Technical Advisory #2 is for Travel. Click Here to read full advisory (PDF)

div.class: inner col col24 first last ida6e17434-1fdd-43aa-a50e-53ce82ab8db4

h2.span: What To Do If You Are Sick With COVID-19

ul.li: Call your doctor if you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 and develop a fever and symptoms. DO NOT go to the Hospital Emergency Room unless you need to seek prompt medical attention for worsening symptoms (e.g., difficulty breathing).
If you have a medical emergency and need to call 911, notify the dispatch personnel that you have, or are being evaluated for COVID-19.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id46b3e49d-803f-4114-a6a0-e35653834d19

ul.li: Cole County Health Department Does Not provide testing for COVID-19.
Please call your doctor or 877-435-8411 for specific testing information.

Do you want to know where the Mobile Testing Locations are located in Central Missouri? Please see the map below for the locations. *This map is only for Mobile Testing Locations and informational purposes. Information is subject to change*Â

div.class: inner col col24 first last ida39614b4-77a5-47b5-97a2-18962833e717
inner col col24 first last idb9e0de5d-03b8-4b01-ac15-ccf78acd1a6a

ul.li: Wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer if soap and water is not available.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
